hGBZ0nnl2D_I-G8jR3QX8g.text: We stopped in for breakfast at the Buffett. It was set up nicely with an omelette station cooked to your order. They also have donuts, fruit and other breakfast items. They serve from 7 am to 2 pm which is breakfast/brunch service. The price is $18.99 per person. It's a great way t start your day while at The hotel.

qm0h88ufqzozLZiGQix4dQ.text: This place was delish!! So many Items hot fresh fully stocked service was great host very friendly clean plates with no scratches. Mmm love this place

2fL08VFvWc76qOF3kBFfBA.text: The buffet was nice and clean but the food wasn't too great. There was not a lot of options. Just wish they had more items to chose from. The upside of it was being $21 for dinner vs the rest of the buffet on the strip.

jqpaa_ADJfgyX25G-1_8Gg.text: So, so disappointing! Took my sister for a "nice" lunch, and was shocked that such a place even exists. Please don't eat here unless you like to pay $50+ for worse than tv dinner tasting food.

FBccHhJdOqMxjMSLfIq2dA.text: If you are into spending a lot of money for a mediocre meal then this is the place for you.  My husband likes ribs and decided to give them a try.  He chewed . . . and chewed . . . and chewed . . . and the meat grew tougher . . . and tougher . . . and tougher.  To say it could be described as the bovine equivalent of old ram would be an understatement.  I'm glad I decided to stick with the salad bar followed by a plate of vegetables.  At least there is less probability of them doing anything to spoil such offerings.

9TDLwZ5II5E_rojJ7gZrsQ.text: Place was actually pretty good I don't know why there's no many bad reviews . I think people expected a lot more but it's a dam buffet your not at a fancy restaurant but for a buffet it was good I think breakfast was okay dinner was probably the best time to go it's actually good I don't know why people rated it so low the service was good .  They had a variety of drinks and desert , they could add more food but the place isn't that big so I guess it's understood, and it is a good price

xVD3d636_gMLdcHuIuCCJQ.text: Do not waste your money here! We spent $91 for three adults to eat dinner, and that included an 18% tip that they tacked on. For a buffet!! The service was terrible, we had to get our own drinks, and the server only came by once at the end of the meal to clear away a few plates. And the food was disgusting. Everything was cold, the prime rib was tough, and the chocolate cake was hard as a rock, like it had been sitting out for a week. I would have rather spent $100 on gambling, at least then I would have had a chance at a good outcome.

OFpl2nFhirCXU3emdTI28g.text: Food is cold and disgusting. There is no regular diet coke or diet pepsi. The coffee is cold. Why are they still in business? This place is a joke!

yX4f4luhyFYW9_B91GkLfA.text: Food here is great lots to choose from and service here is very good and friendly. Been to other buffets before here in Vegas but this one is better then most. Must try!

xgCMg151-_yMfRR38SBlNg.text: Decent food. Place is clean and no line for dinner buffet. I had a buy one get one off so it was pretty good but I wouldn't pay full price.

2Bo4IkHcInUy7i1lUkJsng.text: The dinner buffet was amazing great selection of food with friendly staff.Very inexpensive and the food was hot.

I'VE EATEN ROAD KILL that is far more palatable than anything here.   I wouldn't feed this to my dogs. You will be better off just eating your money.

mAsPVlUWsYLb_PtE7tOk8g.text: Compared to other Vegas buffets I've been to, this is subpar. Ordered from the pasta station and my fettuccini Alfredo tasted like plain noodles it was so watery. They have the Pepsi soda machines which we really enjoyed because my kids love picking out their own drinks. There was a very limited selection of fruit and foods. I wasn't impressed by any means. The service was good so I gave it two stars. But I wouldn't go back again.

2fpVgxKBOQaccF2CdN_uNA.text: Don't eat here!!! My sister and I ate here the day we landed in Vegas since we were staying at the hotel. We got instant food poisoning. Couldn't even make it back to our room before we were running to use the restroom. We contacted the hotel and management but no response. Worst customer service ever from management, despite having security file a report no follow up to see if we were ok was made by the hotel staff or management. At $20.99 per person I'd suggest you go anywhere else.  I attached pictures of the food we left in our plates. Completely inedible. Wasn't even there 20 mins and yet that was plenty to get sick off of... RUN away!!!

EXsq5kkXHIkRlbLpjG1w_Q.text: Gross, bland small buffet. We came to Vegas expecting WOW buffets and the circus circus buffet is so disappointing. The chicken fried steak was hard and tasted like it was heated up in a microwave. My 11 year literally spit the baked chicken out and my husband found hair in his gravy. Over $100 spent on this buffet and regret every penny. Dont waste your time or money here, you will regret it as soon as you look at the food. This casino makes alot ofmoney, they really need to invest more into this buffet.

sDq-hCXbMbdYteTufLj81w.text: Living in Vegas, I consider myself a buffet expert. First off, don't listen to the bad reviews, I had dinner here and it was excellent. The pasta station and Italian selection were the highlight of the evening. Not to mention the bbq ribs and fresh slices of roast beef. Second, if you read the bad reviews, the majority of bad ones are about the breakfast or service. The place is 100% self serve so there really is no service other then them picking up the plates. The bad breakfast reviews are probably from hungover people dumb enough to pay $20 for breakfast. Get a coffee and a bagel like normal people!

-PpGU9LsW0lMgKa1P0doWg.text: For A Dinner Buffet Knowing theres so many great buffete on the Strip why go here. The quality of the food is terrible. The choices for the buffet obviously fits circus circus but it's not worth it. It cost about the same as the other great Buffets on the strip so dont dine here. It I have to say it's really Chunty now ..the Atmosphere feels like the Caravan ..I was in line surrounded by Chunts and it felt like we were at the border hoping to get in to the US..it may sound bad but it looked bad. This buffet didn't feel clean..felt...felt....felt...Old. but hey, that's why I wrote this to save everyone from dining in here..come to circus circus only to take your kids to the dome..then again the entrance is too pricy for what you get but for vegas..that's good for them..BUT not for the food..as a matter of fact.. the rooms aren't all that either ..but focusing on the Buffet..Not worth it ..well leave it at 2 stars..oh, and I also took a picture of this kid putting his foot print in the parking lot wall..hopefully Yelp wont delete it

photos.caption: Photo of Circus Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I caught this kid putting his shoe print in the parking lot of this buffet

fUWa4xp265MDh68pdtIvTQ.text: Simply put, NO!!!  Other that the staff nothing was good. It all taste like food prepared for people who would eat anything just because they have a mouth.   There are lower end restaurants / buffets and below that is Circus Buffet.  To summarize: NOISY, DIRTY and TASTELESS DISHES.

d_pteb77qicO3EMlurDIWQ.text: I would not recommend you wasting 30 bucks on their buffet.. ours was free so I guess I can't complain much..   Nahhhh I like conplaining  Let's just this place is very old.. not very much selection and the food is bland..   I pretty much tasted everything they had.. and every single one of them had no flavor.. tasted old and over cooked.. they have dessert that's not very good as well.. you have to get your own drink.. I understand it's buffet but come on customer service would be nice..

7E4c75ETnCSPpyFDf1ddQg.text: Worst buffet in Vegas I'm sure. If I wanted frozen pizza,  frozen corn dogs and frozen taquitos I would go back 20 years to the house I used to babysit and raid the freezer. The desserts weren't even good! Such. Giant waste of money. Even better, when we left Circus Circus the next morning our car window was broken out and all of our stuff was stolen! Never going to lowlife Circus Circus or their ghetto buffet ever again.

aLbiPSYjBrBQBH-ObMtKWQ.text: Ok, first time going to dinner without checking on Yelp first! (Ever since I started using it that is.)   Forgot to eat lunch, and had to go catch Illusionist show at Starlite, and just wanted to eat varieties of food without taking a cab or walking so much, and ended up here. I thought some stuff tasted really good but some tasted like it's gone bad or I just didn't like the taste. And seeing reviews of $$$ (FYI over $100) 4 star buffets, it seems like that's a given at ANY buffets in Vegas so I don't regret coming here for $17.99. Actually surprised at a such low rating.   Fried shrimp, sweet & hot salmon, shell lasagna (name?) and clams were delicious!! The beef was ok, horseradish tasted very spicy and very fresh! I thought egg roll tasted very good as well. String beans were good too, and oh yea the salad was VERY FRESH! Btw I only had cold water here (which I usually do at restaurants), and the water tasted very good. I'm a picky water drinker btw lol (I can't believe I just wrote that lol). Hubby said there was no diet coke (that's what we usually drink for soda) and they have only regular sodas.    Mac & cheese tasted old, but hubby liked it. I didn't get any Mexican food, but hubby got some, and Mexican rice I had a bite of  tasted like it's gone bad or just didn't taste good to me. Maybe it was the butter I didn't like. Hubby enjoyed everything tho. But after he was done with everything he couldn't wait to get out of here and said he can't believe he ate such crappy food. Oh really? That's not what I heard when he was eating!   Soft cream tasted good. I guess you're not supposed to take food to go (there was a sign on the door lol) but I took that to go anyway and hubby said "You're not supposed to!!" and I was like "Who cares! It's Vegas! Don't be so serious!" Hehe   Hubby said that we might get sick from eating this crappy buffet, as he saw me eat a whole bunch of clams, but I felt just fine last night and still feel fine this morning. He said he felt kinda sick last night, and went to the bathroom...I think he was just doing #2 tho lol. I'm sure he was just exaggerating and the nausea was from the cigarette smell at casinos, because he was being pretty negative about pretty much everything last night saying he hates Vegas (this is my first time and second time for him). Yeah I do hate the cigarette smell everywhere and I felt a little nauseous at casinos, but I'm sure they'd stop making money if they make it non-smoking at casinos lol.   I came out of the restaurant pretty darn happy. :)

P-04QOSBFpX2C5p5w48rOA.text: Our family ate here, overall the food/drinks/desert itself is 2 star (food taste like it came out of a box and into the microwave and dry), only reason why I'm giving this a 4 star is because the lady's clearing the tables do a great job, have excellent customer service and go beyond the call of duty. Keep up the good work, if it weren't for you this would be a 2 star. The front house staff, not so nice.

xQ0DMWW4Eli4m-RFW7NfnA.text: It is a decent value for the money. There is a lot of variety, including salad bar, carving station with beef and ham, fish and shrimp, many vegetables, fried rice, Mexican food, and a number of desserts. Drinks are self-service. There is not the interaction from servers that is usually found at buffets, and little busing of tables, but it is relaxing. I did not see anyone leave a tip, probably because there was no service. Children, one in particular, screamed bloody murder the whole time, with no intervention from their parents, and one man behind me mooed like a cow every time the children screamed. Buffets in this price range are usually not the most flavorful, but a decent value for the money, and this one fits right into that category. (Also, the other guests offer unexpected entertainment.) I liked carving station beef, fried rice, mixed vegetables, corn on the cob, apple and blueberry pie.

lNzBs4yXGfYCYdHGvfveow.text: The food was crummy. My home cooking was better than this stuff.  My son and I ate there the experience was  fair at best.  We will never go back.  I did taste the cookies and they were good. The service was fine. They took our plates in a timely manner.  Would not recommend this to anybody. A waste of $40.00.

51UWcYhOk4l6fiMALgCwTg.text: I don't know what every one is complaining about!  Seriously I'm vegetarian so I have HALF the options most people have here & I still had a yummy filling meal.  There are steamed veges & mash & a nice salad selection that was quite impressive (considering the reviews I'd read previously) they also had a vegetarian soup selection which was nice. There was another bar we didn't even make it to, I can't even tell you what else was there that we may have missed!  Lastly the desert bar was sooooo good!  don't get me wrong, I am NOT easily impressed, but when you pay $17 for an all you can eat buffet you really need to be realistic. I actually really enjoyed it & I'm glad I went against the yelp reviews & tried it :)

f25mRrJFPcc6GVP6qGSHdw.text: WORST buffet ever.  Hopefully it was just this visit or something about this day but everything was bad.  Well the soda was good.  It actually tasted like soda.  The Chinese style food was cold. The guy carving the meat looked annoyed and seem to now want to be bothered.  Mexican style food was cold. Mashed potatoes were cold.  Green beans cold. You get the picture.  I seriously should have went through McDonald's drive through for my family of four.  I will never come here again.

tRzO82TQqKEYs7qCzpNv0Q.text: You get what you paid for. Good cheap meal compared to strip prices you can't beat it.

CgieOIpchD6aKFDbB5ZtZA.text: Okay so read a number of reviews that were not very complimentary to the buffet. We enjoyed the food. Was it outstanding - no; was it gourmet -no but it was fresh, honest food that hit the spot after a long time travelling and had a reasonable selection.  Quick, convenient and reasonable price -I would say go there.

IGDJaoS2iWK74fh2pBJ-AA.text: I have very fond memories of coming to Circus Circus when I was a child, my family and I always made it a priority to come to Circus Circus when ever we visited due to the family friendly environment. We went to the midway arcade and watched the free circus shows and to end the fun filled day we would dine at at the Circus Circus Buffet. Unfortunately food quality has gotten alot worse since the last time I visited. The food is hard, stale, and overcooked. The choice of foods now is also much more limited. The beverage oasis has watered down drinks and broken down mocha machines. Im suprised at how bad things have gotten. At this rate I dony know how much longer they will be able to stay in business.

sRnmFenGeiYMIQ1ZOlbfLQ.text: The 2-star average review of this place is very accurate.  Few choices of food, compare to how much some other hotels offer.  $20.99/adult is relatively inexpensive here, but we felt this buffet actually had a lot less than a half of the variety that other hotels offer for $40/person.  I personally did not see anything I wanted to eat, and barely ate a plate of salad and two small bowls of chicken noodle soup.  Their dessert cakes were horribly only sweet made with cheap cake mix you could buy anywhere.

XPOUX8Cm6ab3DG0Ou3Fo3w.text: Not the best, but really not as bad as other "reviewers" have made it out to be. Had breakfast here on a weekday during our stay at Circus Circus. Good selection of standard breakfast fare. One plus is the way their beverage station is set up seperate from the main serving area, with ample room and equipment to serve many guests at once. Choice for the days you just want to stay close to the room and not venture too far

SOTDHsVgC0yum3e6zaz6QA.text: Never in my life had something like this!!! Food is poor don't know how someone could pay this !!!!sorry but next time I'll go to Cesar palace buffet instead

1GNWU3eIZliBXbmBqA21ow.text: Everything was decent except the dessert. Took a bite of the muffin and didn't even want to swallow it. Definitely wasn't the best buffet but you get what you get for paying only $18. Recommend if you're super hungry or you're a poor student like me.

zJ5vo2pS5RLsVZz0XywmpQ.text: I recently had to go to Las Vegas for a business trip and thought we would try to see some of the sights.  We thought the Pink Pony was still around and Richard was all excited to eat there again.  We were sad to find it was no longer in business, but we were starving and decided on the buffet.  This was awful.  Most of the food was completely inedible.  It looked and tasted like it had been out for hours.  It was all greasy and dried completely out.  Richard had prime rib, which was incredibly over cooked and extremely tough.  The best part was honestly the chocolate milk.  Even the cranberry juice delivered from an outside source had a weird, not-quite-right taste about it.    I forgot my computer on this trip, or else I would have yelped and saved myself about $35 on horrible, bland greasy "food".

lHQV-cJVtJfdayFmXfryJw.text: I wanted to see if this place still had the same service and quality since i was a kid. After going through a barrage of marketing and families, our group saw the Circus Buffet Sign only to be seeing a HUGE LINE for just BREAKFAST.   It wasn't a zig zag line, it was just 3 lines and it was short...lol. I noticed that a lot of people are getting a day pass or the All You Can Eat Pass...lol. Geez...talk about Gluttony in the City of Sin. We had four in our party ($10.49 per person) with the 8.1% Sales Tax. Our total was $45.36.  After you pay, you are seated and off you go. There are two sides and the both serve the same things, but from what I heard, breakfast is the best time to go. I got myself eggs, sausages, corn hash, sausage patties, pancake wrapped pie, bacon, and anything breakfast. They had a drink section which is larger than their breakfast area. They had different kinds of milk to sodas..lol. I guess hydration is more important.  One plate of food had done it for me. I got fruit, but it didn't help. It was like they added MSG or something to make you get full fast. Oh well, it was a good breakfast, but wasn't average breakfast. I would like to have seen more or even include Brunch since we came in at 1030am.   Hope you Have Fun here and Keep Yelping!!

jJPYr5RCCHl2aVM4VuKYdg.text: Went during brunch hours. Price was reasonable for the variety of food offered. Good for families with young kids since they have a section for kids favorite foods. The staff was friendly and very attentive.

KwTLN-SoKEZGU-dg9Ko-nQ.text: The food here at the circus circus buffet was horrible waist of eighty bucks but shame on me for not yelping this place first eighty bucks for 4 of us figured for what I paid it was going to be good bullshit not ever going to eat here again

48P3ahza22gdtB7ceMF7MA.text: I wanted to just write reviews for places I think are awesome but wow. I really have to warn people about this place!  Yelp did not lie to me, I should have trusted what people said here. This buffet has possibly some of the worst food I've ever had. Stay farrrr away! They even messed up HOT DOGS. They just sit there, soaking in liquids for who-knows-how-long. Hard-boiled eggs are tough like rocks and scrambled eggs are cold and unpleasantly mushy. The seafood pasta was bland. And all the breads and donuts and pastries were stale! I know Circus Circus is a bit of a walk from the Strip and this buffet is cheaper than others but it's worth the energy and money to go elsewhere! Even Hometown Buffet dumps on this place.  Seriously, my boyfriend will eat anything and even he is turning up his nose. BAD BAD BAD.

_ea30TPxyB8U8JbHwBRr1w.text: Everything was horrible. I hope we don't get sick after eating at this place. Kids are charged as adults at 11 yrs old & up. Very disappointed.

2CAcyBvLQLZ1uCSaKfHpFw.text: This was the worst buffet I have ever been too  I paid 79$ for 4 people . WTF not even worth it  don't waste your money on this food.

xo8r2HvQ1_4ewtVtYLwKsA.text: We love buffets. Our mistake was by not checking into Yelp first.  First We waited in a very short line for over a 1/2 hour because the 1 & only cashier was training a new person, which I understand, except when you literally make your patrons wait, wait & wait some more.  Once to the register we learned how much a meal would cost.  Child:  $11.99, Adult $18.99.  Wow! But we figured as big as it was there would be a great variety of food options.  NOT! And the minimal amount of variety they did have didn't taste all that well.  Husband got fried chicken & said it dry, I got fish without any flavor, the guy who was cutting the ham was also making waffles so that the 2 times husband wanted ham & me once, he was unavailable so we never got any.  Daughter was highly disappointed in her food.  I ate mostly salad.  $19.00 for a salad.  Could've gone to Sizzler & got more of a variety for 1/ 2 the price.  Chuck O Ramma has a better buffet than this.  I don't recommend this restaurant to anyone.  They had an "A" rating hanging up by the register.  We joked they must of paid someone for it, as we rated it a big fat "F".

61j_EA83HIGaBuUAboqJWA.text: I admit to only trying the buffet once, but really it was hardly edible. Nearly 20$ a person for the dinner buffet and most everything my party of 4 attempted to eat was inedible. The salad bar was very sad with few ingredients. The vegetable dishes were soggy and flavorless. The pasta was soft and mushy. The prime rib was tough and overcooked. I did have an unlimited supply of soda and coffee and my banana tasted pretty normal, but other than that I was sad to have spent the money. I had debated getting a subway sandwhich instead and wished I had stuck to that idea. I know everything in Vegas is expensive, but there are many similar priced buffets that are higher quality. Its hardly worth the price to pay for something that is all you can eat if you can only eat half of what you put on your plate. Service was attentive.

RubgqNiHt2bEk_hC4q0HyQ.text: What a pleasant breakfast buffet!  This buffet is not elegant like the Billagio or Wynn buffets down the street but for the price there is more than enough to please. With an omelet bar and breakfast meats, biscuits, waffles and other international foods you cannot go wrong. There were also cereals and fruits available along with coffee, fruit drinks and other beverages.  Not too sure why people complain soo much about this buffet. In Hawaii you could get a below par buffet for one at sizzler's for what we paid at the Circus Circus Buffet for two people.  The only reason why this place didn't get a 5 star was the employees that tended to our table were either yelling over us in Spanish or Filipino to other workers and they seemed a bit rude to us after we were seated.   But all in all it was not disappointing. It was appealing and I had a good 3-4 plates. It sure beats the McDonalds next door that gives small portions for 1/3 of the price, and if you are staying in the circus circus hotel it is definitely worth it if you don't want to walk to find food in what was at the time 20degree weather.

H1scJb5UqGYVTtbxqiGmTg.text: Honestly I had my own reservations about coming to Circus Circus buffet due to my fellow Yelpers. However I can't even lie, after eating there I can say my experience was nothing but positive. The food was pretty good and even though the selection could have been better, the prices aren't too bad. I couldn't remember going as a kid, but just knew I liked it then as well. Sorry guys, I disagree... not a bad experience for me!

jlNK2GBKso5-mHQD8e53eQ.text: Actually in town for vacation for once and for the sake of saving time took them here (kid wanted to win some stuffed animals).  I will keep this short so just don't come here.  There are much better options out there.  The food is edible at best.  I also missed half the breakfast making waffles for these little mexican kids who didn't speak english (which I was happy to do and not really a knock on the buffet - well kinda because there should be a guy making waffles).

yk3X5y8_SjRBuf0kvYCing.text: Horrible and  $$$$$ list your food ingredients get some veggies out vegans will starve here and go broke

imRs1Tb_pBgFzAztEXSErQ.text: My boyfriend wanted to check out this hotel/casino and our group was starving so we decided that for the price, we would just suck it up and eat here. Um...........  The food was meh. There was nothing that was such a hit that I felt the need to go back up to get it. Except maybe the diet Coke.   Oh well, you live and you learn. Next time, we'll just stop at the Walgreens by the Venetian and get bags of Doritos.

rDouzsM4XIVWKBVTzhemJw.text: I used to come here when I was younger, probably 7 or 8 ish, the price is pretty dirt cheap and my parents almost always said the food is merely fast-food level. But I thought the food was pretty good. But as I matured, my palate did as well.  The last time I came here was the summer of 2011, I was 13 at the time. Memories were spawned when I walked past here and I decided to eat there. The staff was rather disgruntled due to the fact it is late and I came in with my family. I even heard them quietly say "UGH, another group?!" well I am SO sorry that the dining area is a quarter filled and it is 8 in the night. It's Vegas, expect some people to come at night. I couldn't wait to eat the food, but as soon I sunk my teeth in the fried chicken, it was kinda chewier than i remembered it to be and the batter coating is pretty hard. I ended up getting cuts in my mouth from the chicken. It was pretty greasy too. I remember grease flowing from my fingers to my arms.  The sliced lamb was rather lean... None of the food didn't feel special enough to the point of getting seconds.  I went to get dessert instead and got some chocolate eclairs and brownie cake. It tasted rather fake. What I mean by that is that it tasted like you would find it in the freezer section in the supermarket due to its dry and crumbly texture. For the rest of the time, I filled up on sprite and went home to my room to eat cup noodle because apparently, cup noodles tasted a whole lot better. I usually don't rate bad places with one star since I'm pretty lenient with rating, but this place downgraded ever since i was 8 and clearly deserves the one star.

e_cj6SxU4HzFAzrXbjzoOQ.text: I will have to admit that I was pretty disappointed with Circus Circus buffet.  It was much better than I thought it would be.  I came here hoping to recalibrate my Vegas buffet meter and I was looking for something that was a 1 or a zero.  Not to say that there still aren't elements that put them in the running for the worst buffet I have been to - including totally dried out food items, and rude staff.  Long gone are the days when you could eat here for 5 bucks and get the worst case of heartburn in your life. Anything that incorporated a meat mixture tasted like they were using offal in their food long before it became trendy.  But sadly, the price has gone up to just under $20 for dinner and so has the quality.  Now, instead of being horrendous, they have climbed the rank to reach the status of dorm food - just palatable and recognizable enough. (any place that has milk dispensers is guaranteed to be like dorm food)  To summarize my findings and some of the items  Corn dogs - dried out and grey wieners just like you find at AM/PM  Sliced beef - I needed two gulps of water to get this baby down.  Dry dry dry  Fried chicken - greasy and dried out like the Hungry-Man frozen dinners  Taco meat - amazing reproduction of the beef filling used in Taco Bell  Burritos - an exact replica of Tina's 25 cent frozen burritos  Lasagna - Can we say Stouffer's?  Mac n Cheese - Kraft Mac n Cheese is cheesier  and my favorite... there is a station that has some stuff just labeled as "meat" - Awesome!!!

b7niqpUDeaT3PRxtfIMXng.text: Probably, one of the worst buffets in Las Vegas.  The only good thing about it was that it was not too expensive.  Compared to similar priced buffets in Vegas though, this place is awful.  The food is tasteless.  It was so bad that I did not even eat too much which is really saying something for me cause I'll eat just about anything.  Do not come to this buffet.  Your money would be better spent or gambled elsewhere.

EADKHLBxyMbB6eIQvYsx0Q.text: Its been soooo long that i've been here but having a baby, this is the place to hang out and play games!  Came here Sunday around 10:40am and i had 20 mins to spare before lunch started.    Place is ghetto and food sucked!   Thankfully, while waiting in line, the lady in front of us, gave us her free buffets since she didn't want to wait in line.  LOL  (Saved us $25!!)  Don't waste your time eating here!    For lunch- all they had was pasta, hamburger, hot dogs, and vegetables.  (no bueno and the cost was $14.  Breakfast- simple eggs, cornbeef hash, crispy bacon, sausage, french toast, and pancakes.    Desserts was a blah  Only good thing bout this place was that you get to self serve your beverages.  Overall, save your money and go elsewhere...

sDJOeePhN_hjkBC2A-pVRA.text: The worst buffet I have ever had in Vegas or Reno for that matter! Everything tasted like it was frozen food, no flavor and way overpriced for the garbage that they served. STAY AWAY!

MzrF0jddVDw2pDSFOBrP2Q.text: We went to Circus Circus for my daughter's birthday, per her request, so she and a few friends could hang out in the adventure dome.  Prior to the fun, we decided to have dinner in the Buffet.  I grew up coming to this Buffet and was so excited for the nostalgic atmosphere as I remember it being a great place to go when I was a child.  We got there and the place had changed drastically from what I remember.  (Granted it had been about 20 years since I last had eaten there.)  However, we paid our $20/person and we continued on going through the buffet line, choosing only a few things that looked appealing.  As we were gearing up for our second plate, we noticed a large cockroach crawling on the ceiling right above the buffet line- of course halting our appetites.  My fiance quietly notified one of the servers about the insect and asked to speak to the manager to get a refund.  However, when the manager showed, he would not acknowledge us and kept his back to us the entire time.  Out of frustration for waiting minutes staring at his back, we ended up just walking out of the buffet to many apologies from the server.  Surprisingly, the buffet had an "A" grade.  Sadly, I would not recommend this place to anyone and will not be returning in my lifetime.

G-jrVccevkayOIHsO5-iHw.text: I know what you're thinking....why would you COME here?!?!!  Yes...i am a 25 year old girl who is still a kid at heart and I wanted to come to circus circus to rekindle my childhood by playing games!  Is there anything wrong with that?  Well as we were walking, I was super hungry and was going to get a McRib at McDonalds but my dad saw a sign for a lunch buffet that was $12.  Okay I was desperate and hungry so we decided to go in.  First bite of mac and cheese and I was in heaven!  The food was good at first but then after awhile, everything just went downhill.  I had a little bit of everything and it seemed pretty mediocre or really bad!  I was so full that i forced myself to eat dessert because you can't have a meal without dessert!  I got some chocolate brownie cake and it was STALE!!  The desserts looked appetizing but all of them were pretty much stale or tasteless.  I think the only thing I enjoyed here after debating for awhile is the coffee:)  Yes, this is a pretty cheap place if you are looking to get some food but I would probably never come back here ever again.   NOTE: -bathrooms inside the buffet

eiHKRuwqwqI6OKI-bl7u4g.text: To be honest this place is not that bad. My dad told me that the last time he was here the food and service were horrid, but it has improved sooo much. Not really my first place to eat at but still good. Some improvements still need to be made such as labeling, some foods are obvious of what they are, but some things like the pies in the desert area are hard to figure out.Also the shrimp was a little on the rubber side. All in all, Circus Buffet is not bad,but could be better.

ugn1uKg52K13TddAqT8_kw.text: They might as well just call the circus buffet "vomit in a bucket".   This has got to be the absolute worst barfet in the entire city of Las Vegas, and the strip, and Nevada for that matter. If you'd like to be made ill, given food poisoning, spend the rest of your trip with diarrhea - then visit the circus buffet!

SJCSsOBhQ8tx30x_Ry_D_A.text: Okay, I was a poor college kid traveling with my friends few years ago and I still remember this horrible buffet now and want to WARN EVERYBODY NOT TO GO THERE! Even if you pay me now.   So, back then, we walked by their ad and saw some nice pictures for the circuit circuit dinner buffet. OH Boy... should have read the yelp reviews before we enter. My friends weren't even picky about food. We went there VERY HUNGRY but the everything there was just TERRIBLE.   Food were cold, no flavor, taste like leftover from a long time ago. Let alone that all the "hot" food were either lurk warm or cold, shrimp didn't taste like shrimp, chicken didn't taste like chicken, cakes were terrible, the fruit didn't even taste fresh. We had to spit out some of the disgusting food. At the end, I think we all just ate a bunch of watermelon to fill our tummy.  Service.... er...was there any?  The next day, we decide to go to McDonald for Breakfast instead.

IYdubn3A6mUNQRLHtV1mdA.text: Not the best buffet in town. Minimal food selection, especially for the main dish. That's all I can say

hBMM331l9vejN0orpidybw.text: I was here yesterday I payed $19.95 but I would not had spend that money at this buffet the food was not good no flavor dirty. Next time I come to Vegas I will just spend $40.00 on a good buffet. Bottom line I will never go there no more !

cdSVVab_cjPvjt9_J9XOew.text: The food  was horrible not a good selection.. The fried chicken tasted like it was frozen fried and refried. The pancakes look like science experiment that seriously failed. It was way too expensive for breakfast.. Save your money..

DvFDbUnyTKMIoa4OTpyOTw.text: No better than very basic cafeteria food and way too expensive.  Avoid at all cost.  I'm not even sure how we did not get sick on what we ate. Stay away!

8ACJR0-hEVwAsRahPnLyYQ.text: Simple and to the point. I only gave them one star in order to post the review.  We tried the buffet for breakfast; oily raw eggs, raw country fried steak, dried out biscuits, grainy mushy pies and weak coffee.  We tried them for dinner the first night we were here, not good at all.  This place is expensive and the food is gross. I wouldn't waste your money. Check out Yelp and find a better place to spend your money.

fjfVgBK8twJJnYucVkdspw.text: Shame on me for even thinking Circus Circus would have edible food. The atmosphere was derelict. The food choices were laughable for the price. The dinningroom was old and dirty. The entire thing felt like bad cafeteria food. Please do your self a favor and go elsewhere.

avo62vpuyYWvPIUEfQOj7A.text: I'm sorry to say this, but the food is not worth paying for, everything was nasty. Fried chicken was horrible and it was really dry with no meat and the salmon was raw with a slimy taste. Y'all need to do better, because it look like y'all don't care about the customers.

idsp2vISeUE5EG6gciTW8g.text: Food is just okay.  Pricing is absolutely ridiculous.  Service is poor.  If you want to spend more money on food than you should, go somewhere else.  If you are so starving that you feel like you are going to die and have money to just throw away because you won the jackpot, then go ahead and eat here.

IPlqeLwBlTXtYJjewxCBEQ.text: Don't do it  Not many options to choose from the main station and the food is not cook up to great standards. The place is overpriced for shitty quality food. You all should try to find another buffet place while in LV. Great disappointment....

d7pS0iOH4_p5ZyInFGrSoA.text: I'm not a buffet expert, so really take my opinion with a grain of salt if you love it.  Aside from that, I liked the buffet here because it wasn't your "over the top, super decadent, 100 desserts and counting, let's eat here for 5 hours so we can try everything" buffet.  It is a decent sized buffet, with enough variety that you don't get overwhelmed, coffee is good, and it's not super expensive. It wasn't cheap, but it wasn't like 50 dollars a person either.  The only thing I didn't like was that the line was really long and took forever to move. But, I guess that just makes people more hungry.

wsELpLIkvya-NFLzVFReyQ.text: Should have read the reviews. Almost $24 per person, at that price you would think the food would be good and there would be various types of food. Unfortunately the food was plain, and there was very few types. My brother wanted fruit after his not so good meal but there was only watermelon (very few pieces that actually had anything to eat) and cantaloupe. Yes there is cafe, tea, sodas, but we cake for the food not the drinks. Will not come here again.

7tw2ma3GbMXQF-5xaLSkhA.text: We stay at Circus Circus 2 to 3 times a year due to free comp nights.  It is definitely not because the hotel has awesome buffets..  Last time we ate dinner here I came down with foid poisoning. So I choose not to come here for dinner, plus its 22. 00 per person. Geeez, a lot of money for subpar food.    We did have 2 free vouchers this time, chose breakfast this time.  It was decent.  I did like that they had hot oatmeal and grits.  I an a fan of grits and bacon.  I went to buffet and picked 1 of a few things I might like.  Hubby went to omelet bar..  the omelet had the weirdest tasting eggs.  Like cardbaord for sure.. yucky!!!!  I chose fresh 2 eggs over hard. The bread options for toast were excellent.  The bacon was severely undercooked AND!! THE GIRL BEHIND THE BACON WAS WRINGING IUT THE BACON GREASE FROM THE BACON... YES YOU HEARD CORRECT.  Indian rope burn style wringing.. I was DONE at that point!! Even free has limits for me. The best part was meeting a group from Jamaica and they sat with us..  great bunch of people they were!!!!  I would NOT recommend THIS buffet unless it is FREE. Go to Goldcoast!!! Off of Tropicana blvd down by the Rio!!  Food is better and only 9.00 for card members. 10.00 full price!!!

lJZB0FecNZhNN4QgWpZUaw.text: Over twenty dollars each.  And you don't even get drinks to the table unless you go get them.   Offer from a machine.  Pancakes and waffles just like the Howard Johnson's hotel.  The only good thing is the omelette station.  No fresh fruit.  Pastries are blahhh

JibWx3hD5BP7ySUYVKCaRQ.text: I'm not very picky, but I do think there should be a standard for Vegas buffets, especially at the price of $20 pp, regardless of the meal time. The food just isn't very good. It's not flavorful and I side our daughters corndog was a tan dog.... there are other restaurants in the hotel.... if you don't feel like leaving, do yourself a favor... eat at one of those.

Slvx7XYTKtzmPkNzvYHhdQ.text: This place was awful. Food was not tasty at all. The food was very limited and did not look appetizing. The hygiene and upkeep of the buffet looked unhygienic. You can see left over food being heated up and served. You can also see dirty rags all over the place. I also got a hair in my salmon. Not worth $24.99 at all! I honestly feel robbed. This buffet was one of the worst I've been to.

u6pNghEx5UkhOZxVlnI-wA.text: Probably the worst rating I have ever given for an eating establishment. We stopped in, late at night, when they weren't busy. We were "greeted" by staff that apparently were very tired and just wanted to go home. We went through the buffet, which had food that apparently had been under the heat lamp for most of the day - dry and tasteless. And the carving station chef was less than amenable, requiring us to almost beg him for another slice of meat. I think, for the money, I would drive through a fast food place before ever returning to this buffet.

Rd9aXG70vaRSZx9wZHJODw.text: This place is nice remind me the old Las Vegas  They can do better o the foods. Overall ok experience  I will comeback.

67uJwgIRWW9WV-rPjP3g1Q.text: There's only been two worse eating experiences in my life: being served my Dad's left nut, and being served my Dad's right nut. Don't eat here.

7e8kcoVz3h7TIhMkCR7Khg.text: As the last person wrote, I should have read the reviews.  The food is definitely not worth the price.  Golden Coral is better than this place.   As noted selections limited food did not taste great.  I assume nothing was house prepared.  Frozen or canned.

-RpRaAlFa2YDfadp5HAW9g.text: Just spent $75 for me plus my 5, 10 and 12 year old for brunch.  Most food looked worse than Elementary cafeteria.  We only opted for breakfast since that's pretty hard to mess up.  Canned fruit, no fresh. Scrambled tasted eggs worse than eggs st summer camp. Breakfast meat no flavor and not cooked well. Donuts, muffins and bread pudding are all we were able to get down.  And they were stale.    Go splurge on another buffet....

wSllFHOa7dOYpC4EKrdctw.text: Went to adenturedome, so we checked out this buffet.  At only about 20 dollars. I would say it was overpriced.  Quality of food  was  not very good.  And not much flavor.  There was nothing i went back for a 2nd time,  even desert  selection was lacking.   For about 10 bucks more you can get a much better buffet someplace else.   It is what it is and it was just low quality food. On a positive note the saff was great. And the coffee was. Good.

iw7R8yYacDPs0FCiftVLGw.text: When you're a kid, all the stories of gambling, strippers and debauchery you hear about in Vegas don't have as much appeal to you as the sound of a buffet; ice cream, doughnuts, spaghetti, meatloaf, sausage and waffles all on one plate?!?!? To a kid, that sounds like an awesome breakfast!  Unfortunately, they don't do "breakfast" here....they only do "brunch".  After coming here, I've learned brunch is defined as: we're going to call breakfast something different so we can charge you $20.00 per person to eat here, $12.00 per little person, oh, and if you're child is over 3 years old, despite the fact they can only fit a fistful of food in their tummy, you're paying $12.00 too.   Also, they automatically add a $3.00 tip to your bill, so you SHOULD know that (though Circus Circus doesn't think you should, because they won't display that anywhere, or tell you).    Ugh......  The kids weren't impressed.  Not only was the buffet not "circus themed" (other than a few abstract paintings on the wall), the food wasn't good at all.  The eggs were overly runny, the spaghetti was about as good as the canned stuff (my kids are used to homemade), the menudo was all tripe....the kids didn't like anything except for their bowl of yogurt.  No joke.   I thought everything I ate was "OK" at best.  Nothing incredible.  Nothing to be excited for. NOTHING to pay $20.00 for.   The staff here are all very rude as well.  After reading an (apparently old Vegas blog post, despite being written in July of this year), I asked why my four year old was charged for entry, when I thought 4 and younger were free.  The cashier said, "Not any more. It's over 3, so she's paying". I don't know why she thought my daughter would pay, being that she's currently of non-working or wage earning age, but, whatever.  When I asked one of the cooks if they had mac n' cheese today (again, blog post said kids love it), the cook said, "No" and walked away.  Maybe if the casino left the tipping up to the individual, rather than sticking you for $3.00 upon entry, the staff would be friendlier, trying to earn tips??? Just a thought.   Oh well, I won't know, because I'll never come here again.

Ynjlcd_Vm05hAIKXehRn9g.text: Pros:  Food was fresh Friendly staff Kid friendly  Cons:  No seafood Small selection  Expensive

H1J0KUVWbrdgtIddut1E9Q.text: I enjoyed breakfast very much.  Large selection as well as omelette station carving station and more.  Everything I had was very good.

lEGjSinpGMUrAvZILa5R4A.text: Do not eat here! Absolutely the worst meal ice ever had. Pretty much destroyed my tooth on a huge chicken bone sliver in my pasta and sampled a little of most of the foods and they were all barely edible.  Staff was extremely rude when I told them about the bone.

CoCctNKoRzWSZYty6dItUg.text: Good buffet for family's. Everyone crying about it but you should know the better buffets are down the strip.  Fast clearing our plates hot fresh food on a Friday.  Bad thing is drinks like oj n apple juice is warm and with ice it gets water down.

nmQz6gea-CvUp4SJgfF4eg.text: Located in Circus Circus Hotel Casino on The Las Vegas Strip. Ok so I went for breakfast, I was not wowed. It wasn't bad just not great. There is better and cheaper in Las Vegas. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

fLwBTdjUYit9JG9SLN1NHg.text: Not alot of food selection when i go especially during breakfast hours. Very pricey and such a shame the food is a 0

SxBdTfJBRtRmbduTlz-OWQ.text: This is definitely the worst buffet my daughter and I ever had. The place smells stinky and the food tastes old. We lost our appetite after just eating half of our first plate! It was the first time in our lives we had to leave a buffet still feeling hungry. U want to go cheap? Ok no problem, you will get what you pay for. Bon appetite!

wQLkBh-Lq75v0X-CR4bkwg.text: I went here for a late breakfast at about 10:45 AM, and I was still accommodated with breakfast food well until 12 PM. (Even though breakfast supposedly ends at 11 AM.) They had out the lunch food too though, so there was a large number of choices.  Well, there were a large number of choices period. If you've ever gone to a Sunday brunch buffet at Marie Callendars, where you pay over $15 per person, (about $10.50 at Circus Circus,) you won't find even half the variety or quantity of food that you can find here.  Tons of muffins, desserts, bagels, cereal, eggs, cheese omelets, sausage, bacon, stuffed pancakes, french toast, waffles, biscuits with gravy, grits, donuts, fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc... You get the idea. There's tons of stuff.  I don't understand other yelper complaints - it's a buffet, so each food item isn't going to be hand-crafted to perfection with tons of ingredients. You pay the buffet price for a single item to get that kind of quality. Here, again, it's about quantity and variety.  Definitely an ideal spot for anyone with a mild but food-craving hangover.

photos.caption: Photo of Circus Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3CE2uwgPV1NsfrMi7iSYAA.text: It was just ok. Went the morning of 1/9/16 for breakfast. Came to Circus Circus to take my son to Adventuredome for his birthday(separate review). I used a myvegas reward. We came for breakfast. Food was just ok nothing spectacular. Personally i would of just went to Dennys!  Prices were decent. Maybe lunch and dinner are better.

1bCxqPCMgpqWfZCsapNVAw.text: We were on the far end of the strip since my daughter wanted to go there for the amusement games.  It was time for dinner and raining a little, so we decided to eat at the buffet.  The price was low.  We get seated and do the standard walk through to see what was available.  Wow this place looked just like a Country Buffet or Royal Fork.  Fried chicken was really salty and greasy.  Greasy meaning that it had more oil than the normal fried chicken. More than KFC.  The meat cutter at the beef station was really stingy and would only give me one, super thin slice.  I had to go back three more times to get enough to eat.  Did I say he price was low?  The other stuff was very uninspiring. The pasta dishes were mediocre at best.  Salad bar kind of sucked.  For the desserts they seemed like the pies were store bought.  The crusts on the pies were definitely not flakely, more mealy.  In regards to cleanliness, this place needs a good douche. It looks really weathered and needs to update the look to get it out of the '70s.  Did I say the price was low?  Well you get what you pay for.  I don't recommend you eat here unless you just want a large quantity of food for a low cost.

nmCLGnAIRJezHvcjpL5NQw.text: The line must get so crazy long for this place that there is actually a sign that reads "from this point your wait is _____. Don't be fooled. You are not in line and waiting for the thrill to ride a world class roller coaster. We had no wait, and THAT was too long for the food at this buffet.  Muffins come fresh from Costco or Sam's Club. And the coffee is just bad. You may think you are going to get a lot for your money because it is a buffet. But we cursed the day we walked in there and wasted our money.   The next day we went to Denny's and the following IHOP. You will find better buffets in your own hometown no matter where you live. But I thought since this was Vegas, we would get something better. WRONG!

DaXyDSZ9oX6gOkZzf8X1Zw.text: This buffet was SO BAD! Not worth $20 per person. The only reason I tried it was because I received complimentary breakfast for 2 with my room at Circus Circus. The food is bland and CHEAP! I couldn't find one thing to eat.. even the desserts were bad. I've eaten at many buffets before within the same price range but this one was by far the worse and there wasn't much selection. Save your money and go ANYWHERE ELSE!

c9f0F2-oHvzEoDuo-q84lw.text: We just had the breakfast buffett. The fried, diced potatoes were not very warm. The pastries were mostly stale. My advice would be to have them make you a fresh omelet, it was good. It's pretty expensive for what is offered. I prefer Shoney's breakfast buffett to Circus Circus buffett.

4YNS4M3qfvhX3uQh7QTuGQ.text: Most disappointing selection of food and gross not worth $20 take your money somewhere else

mk14hfDAfFO3DjvklyLijQ.text: I went to the brunch buffet. Good variety, food is fresh, omelettes are made to order. Price is a bit steep for a brunch buffet, but other than that, it's a solid choice for buffets.

LERDZ_cjAQeXXmrpic0Zqg.text: Came here years ago, but remember my "experience" vividly. It's without exception the worst buffet I've been to: everything was either dry, soggy, broken down, powdery, or a combination of these. And worst of all, we had to wait in lines for something that seemed straight out of the frozen foods section of a Walmart.  Prices seemed to have gone up significantly since I was here. Why would anyone in their right mind spend more than $15 to eat here, let alone $5, when there are so many better (and even cheaper) dining options in Vegas?

loylFOHrvMLvwFplFdeIXQ.text: I came here for lunch & I was impressed! A very large variety of food, drinks, desert & fruits! Definitely do recommend it! Awesome service as well!!

SBIm8zQ9dT7ZdLenWKEy0g.text: This is like Country Buffet Type food. No steaks, not enough seafood, no crab legs. . They couldn't even seat 13 people together. The food they had was below Vegas quality. Not coming back.

ZjOkkjV50Vm03DHDOaNd4w.text: I don't like writing bad reviews but this place is just horrible . I don't know if it's just popped out of a plastic bag and bumped into the microwave but it's just not what I expected . I wouldn't recommend anybody to go here

DaRoFVa3VhxAhQaKA1ACew.text: This buffet was pretty bad... my wife the kids and I happened to be in Circus Circus around lunch cause we wanted to watch the free Circus acts and decided rather than un-valet-ing the car we would just make an easy stop at the nearby buffet... Mistake... Unfortunately I did not think to pull up the Yelp first because I was pretty hungry and in the mood for variety. We went around 12:30 but 75% of the buffet was still breakfast/brunch items, I'm guessing because they didn't want to waste any food, meaning that everything out was al old and crusty.  The food quality here was lower than any other buffet I have ever been to. even the salad bar was questionable, they only had one choice of lettuce, and the selection of toppings was just sad and basic.  I thought that it would be safe to go with the fresh cut meats from the filet station but those were dry and bland like everything else. The advertised attraction: endless fried shrimp was rubbery and just tasted like chap grocery store frozen shrimp.  as mentioned before most of the buffet and the stations were breakfast based, while only about a 20ft long section of buffet was lunch items, so it was slim pickings, and what was there was questionable at best. the one thing that was okay in flavor and quality were the chicken fingers, but I'm sure they were just cheap food supply ones.   After eating here I spent the rest of the day with very active uncomfortable "intestinal operation" and under no circumstances would I ever eat at this buffet again. If you are reading this, please do yourself a favor and go somewhere else... I know it is simple and easy especially with kids, but just don't do it.

-tgP23vUTS60xIlLwGYiAA.text: The food has always been terrible here. 10 years later, it's still bad. It's such a waste of ingredients for them to cook it this bland. The hotel is cheap so i guess that's why people come here.

XsTlaON5v_TQoWKClBXzVw.text: I wanted to like this buffet. First, for me, Vegas = buffets. Usually go to at least one buffet on each Vegas trip. Second, I have fond memories of the circus buffet as a child. They used to have several lines where each line had the same selections.   We went on a Friday for lunch. The price was $20.99. It was too much for what they offered. For me, the food was ok but not worth $21 a person. The only high ticket item was the fried shrimp which were larger than popcorn shrimp but not jumbo. No peel and eat shrimp no smoked salmon. They had carved ham which was decent. My son was able to cobble together a bacon cheeseburger with the shredded cheese (no sliced cheese) from the Mexican station and bacon from the breakfast station. My other son filled himself up with several bowls of their fake lucky charms cereal (labeled malted marshmallows) but not worth what we paid.   The best part of the buffet was the drink selection. They had the Pepsi machine, lots of juices, and lots of milk choices (2%, whole, and chocolate).

ADpznkvK9c4IUncsYiBbcQ.text: I used to LOVE coming to the circus circus buffet growing up. It was my favorite on the strip and a price you can't beat. My husband and I even came about two years and the buffet was still okay so we thought that we would bring our daughter. HUGE MISTAKE we went last night and we were both utterly disgusted. The food was horrible and the selection was almost none existent. I was so disappointed I had mashed potatoes, macaroni and cheese, fried chicken, fried shrimp and pizza. It was all terrible and the fried chicken tasted like it was weeks old. My husband tried to save the dinner and get dessert but it was horrible as well sadly.  I also love to tip for servers so I left an 18% tip but I didn't know that the servers here now only clear your plate which was a huge disappointment as well as you would think they would also at least bring you drinks.  I hate to say this but I won't be back and I wish there was a way for us to get our money back since we had to stop and get food afterwards since we couldn't eat any of the food here.

Qvy_OkpZIh92Mpv93x-P3A.text: Should have read the reviews before coming. This place is not worth the $24.99! First of all, the food selections were very limited. Most people love the buffets for the seafood. This had stale fried shrimp. Hardly anyother seafood. (No lobster, crab legs, crawfish )Most of the food was cold-warmish and had been out for a while.   There were a few items that were decent to eat. Do yourself a favor and find another place to eat!!!!

UBv4Kf-RePtcFjhZzqHYUA.text: Not a good buffet. A good amount of options (not very yummy) without quality. Priced fairly.

23yzFK-dfv5NgcS1gV_-0w.text: Spent $90 on a family of four and most of the food was pre-packaged stuff. Canned refried beans, canned menudo, frozen burritos and chimichanga (bean and cheese), rubbery hard boiled eggs, hasbrowns were rubbery, most food looked really unappealing. Salad bar was ok but tiny with little selection, although this was bagged lettuce too. Omelette station was decent, but I'm not a big breakfast guy, I felt force to get the omelette because everything else was such a let down. I would have rather gone to The Blue Iguana again, that's saying something if you read my Blue Iguana review. I didn't follow what other reviewers advised and I literally paid the price. WARNING: AVOID FOOD FROM CIRCUS CIRCUS.

photos.caption: Photo of Circus Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen quality Bean and Cheese Chimichangas.

ftOwv4AxwMOi8bqKVSIANA.text: 67-18  We decided to go old school during our last visit to Vegas based on discussions with several friends that stay off the strip. We decided to give it a try......Now for the details....  Buffet was clean and well maintained. However food options were limited and leaned heavy on the greasy side.    The staff was nice and kept tables cleared.  Remember this is an older hotel in the MGM family.  Definitely not the strip type.   The omelets were made to order and fresh, the rest of the food was not very tasty and stuck with us the remainder of the day.   I held on a 3rd star due to the food staying with us throughout the day.   Everything is relevant and the corn beef hash was ok, just not "wow". The Mexican food and salad bar was limited and tended to be geared for kids. This is a big plus for families with children. Price was reasonable and even included with some players cards.   When in Rome...... and definitely one of the places on our retro weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Circus Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelet to order with all the fixins.....

GkmJ4W-GTHxcOBxz_rQQ_A.text: Decided to try the dinner buffet. First off, most of the food was incredibly average. However my 1 star review is the fact that I got some of the cream puffs from the buffet, bit into one and something tasted disgusting. I checked and found MOLD on the bottom of the cream puff. The buffet had MOLDY food. I spat it out, took the rest of the moldy food to an employee and showed it to them. The employee took it and showed a manager. The manager gave me a half hearted apology, saying that the cream puffs arrive to them, pre-frozen. Pre-frozen or not, how do you miss literal moldy goods being served to customers? There wasn't any real sincerity and it was obvious they didn't care.   So please don't waste your money here. Unless you want to risk eating food that can make you ill.

FSY-A6kLdYoAr0OexGAyzA.text: Let's just say this place wasn't meant for me. It's crazy how I told my step son this buffet is gonna be like national lampoon Vegas vacation buffet scene. When Clark Griswold goes to a buffet with Ellen's brother in law Eddie go to that  nasty looking buffet with  blue beef and super yellow chicken. Well that's what this placed me reminded me of. Corn bread is as hard as bricks. Crisscut fries were super hard. Everything looked discolored and bland. I only had 1 plate and left ! What a waste of $70. I wish I could be Reimbursed for such unsatisfied unsatisfactory food

ChE6-7iumkQVvCd7SpntxQ.text: Las Vegas buffets are something to write home about. Went to the breakfast buffet at 7:30am, thinking, sweet, everything will be fresh. Bragged to the kids how much they were going to love it. $19.99 per adult, $13.99 per child. No bad.  Wrong. So wrong.  Hard pancakes, rubbery eggs, Serve 'n Brown sausages, tiny hard biscuits with watery gravy, greasy overcooked triangle hash browns, thawed caned oranges, pineapple, and pears- flavorless and watery, hard & dry muffins. Didn't try anything at the Asian or Mexican station, as it looked dry and over cooked, or maybe over heated, instant coffee, and Tang orange juice.  Decent- bacon, grits, and coffee cake.  The kids barely ate anything because their pancakes were so hard.  One star because the bus man was singing along to Katy Perry playing overhead and brought us lots of napkins and cleared our plates quickly.  Such a disappointment.

xR2LD90jexm4TR5Rb9tF9Q.text: It's cheap. You get what you pay for.  You want a really good buffet, go to the Wynn, Caesars Palace or the Bellagio where the buffet will run you about $50 pp (add another $15-$20 for bottomless alchohol).  The buffet here for brunch here was about $20 for adults, and $13 for children. I believe my 2 year old was free.  They had a champagne special for a full-size bottle of champagne for $15. Hell yeah!   The food was fine. Nothing special. I don't know why people feel the need to write such negative reviews about a budget buffet. You want a REALLY good buffet with TONS of food to choose from? Go somewhere else and pay more. It's really as simple as that.  I did notice the buffet was missing a couple options you would normally expect at a breakfast buffet like waffles. No waffles??? No home-fried potatoes. Huh??? No pizza for the kids. Really??? And, the only thing being served at the meat carving station was ham. I would have expected at least 2 options at the meat station.  The omelet station was really good.  And the best part is there was no line on a Sunday @ 10am although it was filling up as soon as we got seated.  I probably wouldn't stay at Circus Circus again as this trip was more for the kids but if I did I would have no problem returning for brunch. Not sure I would have dinner here though as there are just way too many really nice restaurants in Vegas to choose from but for brunch it's fine for convenience. And it's cheap!

73IBk5gnASdxqWWZDv2rLg.text: The worst. And right when I am paying at the front they are asking what percentage of a tip I want to leave. Ummmm before any service has been performed? No.  I will decide once service is rendered. When my granddaughter and I were seated the only service I received was someone picking up my plate when we finished.  Do you think that a tip is due for this service? No. Anyhow food was awful and the selection was the same. Don't waste your money. This was a Monday brunch/lunch menu I was born and raised in Las Vegas so I've have been to many a Buffett. There is so much better out there to represent .

eCMX2F0clsGCPZQOgYRizw.text: Not worth the price. Terrible food! Taste like pre packaged food. Shrimp and fish taste horrible!

M31RMhr8uGCJtcG37nKsSA.text: If you enjoy buffets--this buffet is value!  plenty of variety and low cost for the family.

ffE2OX2CZ2WK6yhGolJrFA.text: This buffet is the worst I have ever seen/had....food was horrible, selection was weak and the buffet smells like it needs antibiotics....pablo however in the buffet has top of the line customer service and makes the trashy buffet feel a little more upscale with his assertiveness, diligence and positive attitude. As for service I'd give a 5 but at a buffet that is 24.99 good service isnt going to cut it

9M9Xw8l89QbNzqtp2mdoBQ.text: We went to Circus Circus for the Arcade and Adventure Dome which was not half bad and decided to stay for the buffet. We did not check on here for a review which was a horrible mistake. Out of a party of nine, six of us got terribly sick after the buffet, which was our last meal for the day. The six of us that got sick were the ones that had some sort of chicken entree there. Never eating there again to say the least.

l9-6zo15cU9ZV8fjPg4wXQ.text: I went a while ago this month and as a person who lives in Las Vegas I found the circus Buffet very disappointing. Compared to other buffets such as the Santa Fe, Texas, and or Asian buffets. They had very limited food choices and were not that great as well. Overall the place seemed very cheap and very little effort put in to it. I would give it a one star but the two stars are for the waffle machine, kind of hard to use but I found it very cool and amusing that you could make your own waffles.   Overall don't recommend going not worth the price of 24 dollars, etc. (Can't remember how much it was exactly)

5D7u4YipenlUeEOH7x-6Ag.text: Horrible.  No variety and mediocre food.  Not to mention way  over priced for what you get.  Even the coffee is bad.

h65ffdg23QuEVMBhGGhnzA.text: Came here one day to tried out their buffet, but they were close for a day for maintenance, so we came the following day. This buffet is very mediocre with the food selections. Staff were friendly and the cleanliness of the place was good, I just wish they had better food. Went here for brunch and the only thing I like was the omelette station. You can customized it and have just eggs white too. There's not much for me to get like a 2nd or 3rd plate of food. The orange juice in one machine was too water down. I had better experience at other buffets on the strip for the price. Wouldn't recommend this place.
